metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3998 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in glibc. The realpath() function can mistakenly return an unexpected value, potentially leading to information leakage and disclosure of sensitive data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu1').
